Name: Alebrijes
Description: Several towns near Oaxaca are famous for their alebrijes - San Martin Tilcajete being the most famous. In these towns you can wander around and find artisan's studios. They will likely offer you a mezcal before showing off their work.

Name: Barro Negro
Description: Black clay is one of the signatures of Oaxacan pottery. San Bartolo Coyotepec is the center of black pottery craftsmanship in the state. Its about an hour from the City of Oaxaca.

Name: Graphic Art Passport
Description: In 2015 a collective of independent art studios began a program called pasaporte grafico where they invite to visit member studios.

Name: Guelaguetza
Description: Month long celebration of Oaxacan cultures. July is full of official and unofficial events that celebrate the Guelaguetza.

Name: Mezcal
Description: We highly recommend visiting the Mezcal Real Minero Distillery and palenque. Ask us about it and we will help you plan your visit.

Name: Textiles
Description: Oaxaca has  rich history of weaving and textile art. In recent decades, there has been a revival of using traditional dyes and materials to create pieces. The town of Teotitlán del Valle is one of the best places to find textiles.

Name: Cuajimoloyas
Description: Fantastic hikes and nice towns. Cuajimoloyas is a little out of the way but makes a fun day trip. Call ahead - some of these have remained closed to outsiders during the pandemic as they are quite far from hospitals.

Name: Mitla
Description: City nearby with market. Also important archaeological site in town

Name: Monte Alban
Description: One of the premier archeological sites in Mexico. Just a few miles away

Name: Tlacolula de Matamoros
Description: One of the oldest markets in Oaxaca. A fun, must see about 30 km from Oaxaca City.

Name: Museo de las Culturas de Oaxaca
Description: This cultural center houses archaeological artifacts & ancient books in a 17th-century convent.
Address: Macedonio Alcalá s/n, Centro Histórico, CP 68000, Oaxaca De Juárez, Oaxaca de Juárez, Oaxaca

Name: San Augustin's Centro de las Artes (CaSa)
Description: Beautiful museum. Converted textile factory in the countryside. Be sure to the check out the paper making studio.
Address: Av Independencia s/n, Vista Hermosa, 68247 San Agustín Etla, Oax., Mexico

Name: Hierve el Agua
Description: Hierve el Agua is a set of natural rock formations in the Mexican state of Oaxaca that resemble cascades of water.

Name: Jardin etnobotánico
Description: The Ethnobotanical Garden of Oaxaca exhibits hundreds of live plant species, all native to Oaxaca. Planting began in 1998 with plants coming from different regions in the state of Oaxaca; such as arid, humid, low tropical and high mountainous temperate zones. The garden represents the broad diversity of geological formations, types of vegetation and climates that characterize Oaxaca.

Name: Santa Maria El Tule
Description: Fun market next to an enormous cypress tree
Address: 2 de Abril, 8va Etapa IVO Fracc el Retiro, Santa María del Tule, Oax., Mexico

Name: Templo de Santo Domingo
Description: Location of Ceremony, 16th century monastery. It also houses the Museo de las Culturas, which celebrates the cultures of Oaxaca.
